perturbation.original_text:
1.2
“Affiliate” means in relation to any Person, any Subsidiary or Holding Company, and any company in which such Person or any such
Holding Company holds or Controls directly or indirectly not less than 30% of the issued share capital.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.2
“Affiliate” means in relation to any Person, any Subsidiary or Holding Company, and any company in which such Person or any such
Holding Company holds or Controls directly or indirectly not less than 50% of the issued share capital.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Affiliate' is modified to contradict itself. In Section 1.2, an affiliate is defined as a company where a person holds 50% or more of the share capital. This contradicts the original text (30%), creating ambiguity about the required ownership percentage for a company to be considered an affiliate. This could lead to uncertainty about which entities are bound by the 'Affiliate' obligations in the contract.

perturbation.original_text:
1.12
“Control” means, with respect to any Person, the possession, directly or indirectly, of the affirmative power to direct or cause the
direction of the management and policies of such Person, whether through the ownership of securities, partnership interests or other
ownership interests, by contract, by membership or involvement in the board of directors or other management structure of such
Person, or otherwise. For purposes hereof, the holding, directly or indirectly, of 30% or more of the issued share capital of a Person
shall be deemed the Control of such Person.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.12
“Control” means, with respect to any Person, the possession, directly or indirectly, of the affirmative power to direct or cause the
direction of the management and policies of such Person, whether through the ownership of securities, partnership interests or other
ownership interests, by contract, by membership or involvement in the board of directors or other management structure of such
Person, or otherwise. For purposes hereof, the holding, directly or indirectly, of 50% or more of the issued share capital of a Person
shall be deemed the Control of such Person.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Control' is modified to contradict itself. In Section 1.12, control is deemed to be present if a person holds 50% or more of the share capital. This contradicts the original text (30%), creating ambiguity about the required ownership percentage for a person to be in control. This links directly to the affiliate definition issue. This can create uncertainty about who has control, affecting decision-making and obligations.
